subject: Technology
title: Deepfakes: Seeing Is No Longer Believing
description: A fast breakdown of Deepfakes: Seeing Is No Longer Believing for builders.

hook.text: AI can now make a video of anyone saying anything. Your eyes can't tell it's fake. Neither can most software.

buildup.text: Deepfake technology uses neural networks to swap faces, clone voices, and generate entirely synthetic media.

discovery.text: Early deepfakes were obviously fake. Today's versions fool forensic analysts and can be created on a laptop in hours.

twist.text: Deepfakes have been used for fraud, political manipulation, and non-consensual explicit content. The harm is already widespread.

climax.text: We're entering an era where video evidence can be fabricated. Trust in what we see is eroding.

punchline.text: If you can fake a video of anyone, you can't trust any video of anyone.

quiz.question: What is a deepfake?
options: AI-generated synthetic media that can fake someone's face and voice
